summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorney Reid Weingarten and defense attorney Michael Miller regarding logistics for an upcoming court conference in the Epstein case, including transfer of a hard drive and compliance with a protective order.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP representing the Epstein defense team; coordinating delivery of a hard drive and discussing compliance with a protective order ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Prosecutor with the Southern District of New York; requesting a hard drive from the defense and inquiring about their position on a subpoena and expected statements for an upcoming court conference.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about case logistics, evidence transfer, and legal positions ahead of a court conference.

events.title: Upcoming Court Conference
events.description: Scheduled court conference in the Epstein case where the defense team expects to be in compliance with a protective order.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The defense team, represented by Michael Miller, is coordinating delivery of a hard drive containing the first round of production to prosecutor Reid Weingarten.
Miller states the Epstein defense team will be in compliance with a protective order by the time of the court conference, with only minor cleanup points possibly remaining.
Weingarten is seeking information on what the defense team expects to say at the conference and their position regarding a subpoena.
The correspondence indicates ongoing pre-trial evidence exchange and procedural coordination between prosecution and defense in August 2019.
